title: Stokes wants to remain captain despite Ashes defeat
summary: England captain Ben Stokes says he "absolutely" has to the energy to still lead the side after their defeat by Australia in the third Test in Adelaide meant they lost the Ashes at the earliest opportunity.

title: England beaten to lose another Ashes in Australia
summary: England's Bazball regime is in tatters as yet another Ashes series in Australia is lost at the earliest possible opportunity.

title: Booze, beach, beaten â€“ how England lost the Ashes
summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: Cummins & injured Lyon unlikely to play fourth Test
summary: Australia could be without both Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon for the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne, which begins on Boxing Day.

title: England execution not good enough for long enough - Stokes
summary: England captain Ben Stokes expresses pride in his side's "character and fight" in the third Test but admits they were not good enough for long enough to claim a victory.

title: McCullum admits he's made mistakes after Ashes defeat
summary: Brendon McCullum says his side haven't lived up to "high hopes and expectations" after failing to regain The Ashes, but that fans can expect his side to "show what we're capable of achieving" in the final two Test matches in the series.

title: 'I put my hands up' - McCullum admits Ashes mistakes
summary: Coach Brendon McCullum accepts England may have made mistakes with their Ashes preparation after their series defeat was confirmed in Adelaide.

title: Test Match Special Podcast
summary: The Ashes: England's belated resistance ends as Australia retain the Ashes.

title: 10 moments that decided the Ashes
summary: Australia have regained the Ashes after winning the first three Tests against England down under once again - here are the 10 moments that decided the destination of the urn.

title: The moment that Australia retained the Ashes
summary: Marnus Labuschagne takes the catch from Josh Tongue as England are bowled out for 352, giving Australia an 82 run win and a 3-0 series lead to retain The Ashes on day five in Adelaide.

title: 'Test career over for now?' - Ashes player ratings
summary: Chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt marks the performances of the Australia and England teams after the third Test in Adelaide.

title: 'That's the wicket' - Labuschagne takes brilliant grab to dismiss Jacks
summary: Marnus Labuschagne takes another brilliant catch at slip as Will Jacks is dismissed for 47 to leave England on 337-8 on day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

title: 'It's frustrating' - Smith out for 60 after poor shot
summary: Australia make the breakthrough as Jamie Smith is caught for 60 to leave England on 285-7, needing 150 runs to win the third Test on day five in Adelaide.

title: Williamson beats Simpson after four knockdowns in Leeds
summary: Troy Williamson upsets the odds to stop Callum Simpson in brilliant fashion and win the British, Commonwealth and European super-middleweight titles in Leeds.

title: Given shares Howe's frustrations on trio of decisions
summary: Match of the Day's Shay Given shares Newcastle manager Eddie Howe's frustrations after a trio of decisions went against the Magpies in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea.

title: Spurs 'lost control' in defeat to Liverpool - Hart
summary: MOTD Analysis: Ill-discipline cost Tottenham against Liverpool - Joe Hart

title: How Man City smothered West Ham with 'suffocating' press
summary: Match of the Day's Joe Hart looks at Manchester City's "suffocating" press as they looked back to their dominant best in a 3-0 win over West Ham.

title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
summary: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?

title: Calvert-Lewin scores twice as Leeds thrash Crystal Palace
summary: Dominic Calvert-Lewin extends his scoring streak to five Premier League games with a superb double as Leeds United secure a comfortable victory over Crystal Palace at Elland Road.

title: Williamson drops Simpson four times in stoppage win
summary: Troy Williamson upsets the odds to stop Callum Simpson in brilliant fashion and win the British, Commonwealth and European super-middleweight titles.

title: Isak injury in chaotic Liverpool win gives Slot more problems
summary: Liverpool stretch their unbeaten run to six games but Alexander Isak's injury while scoring overshadows win at Tottenham.

title: Gyokores penalty sends Arsenal top of the table in win against Everton
summary: Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokores' first-half penalty sends the Gunners to the top of the Premier League table in win over Everton.

title: Wyatt beats GB team-mate Weston to World Cup gold
summary: Great Britain's Marcus Wyatt beats team-mate Matt Weston to World Cup gold in the men's skeleton in Sigulda, Latvia, while Zoe Atkin claims halfpipe gold in Colorado.

title: Romero wouldn't have seen red if referee 'did his job' - Frank
summary: Cristian Romero would not have been sent off in Tottenham's loss to Liverpool if referee John Brooks "did his job" properly, says Spurs boss Thomas Frank.

title: Man Utd 'could make January signing' amid Neves link
summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is possible the club could make a January transfer window signing.

title: Brighton & Sunderland's first ever PL match ends in 0-0 draw
summary: Brighton's disappointing December run continues as they played out a goalless draw against Sunderland in the Premier League.

title: Broja heads home late equaliser for Burnley at Bournemouth
summary: Armando Broja heads home a dramatic late equaliser as struggling Burnley end their seven-game losing streak by claiming a precious Premier League point at Bournemouth.

title: Haaland scores twice as Man City beat West Ham
summary: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City beat beleaguered West Ham United for a fifth straight Premier League victory which moved them top of the table.

title: Liverpool hold on to beat nine-man Spurs
summary: Substitute Alexander Isak scores for Liverpool before being forced off with injury as Arne Slot's side win a chaotic Premier League match at nine-man Tottenham.

title: Chelsea fight back to claim draw at Newcastle
summary: Nick Woltemade scores an early double, but Chelsea fight back to claim a 2-2 draw against Newcastle United at St James' Park.

title: Dobey dumped out by Gilding as Bunting progresses
summary: World number eight Chris Dobey suffers a shock second round exit at the World Darts Championship with a 3-1 loss to Andrew Gilding.
